smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function onCreateView appears to be too complex.
The function handleMessage appears to be too complex.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function convertToGraph is nested too deeply.

smells.name: LabeledExpression
smells.description: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

instances.message: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

smells.name: EmptyIfBlock
smells.description: Empty block of code detected. As they serve no purpose they should be removed.

instances.message: This empty block of code can be removed.

smells.name: TooGenericExceptionCaught
smells.description: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

instances.message: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.
Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

smells.name: PackageNaming
smells.description: Package names should match the naming convention set in the configuration.

instances.message: Package name should match the pattern: ^[a-z]+(\.[a-z][a-z0-9]*)*$

smells.name: VariableNaming
smells.description: Variable names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Variable names should match the pattern: [a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.name: ObjectPropertyNaming
smells.description: Property names inside objects should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Private object property names should match the pattern: (_)?[A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.description: Enum names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

smells.name: SpreadOperator
smells.description: Using a spread operator causes a full copy of the array to be created before calling a method has a very high performance penalty.

smells.name: UnsafeCast
smells.description: Cast operator throws an exception if the cast is not possible.

instances.message: db.show().findViewById<View>(android.R.id.message) cannot be safely cast to TextView.
db.show().findViewById<View>(android.R.id.message) cannot be safely cast to TextView.
service cannot be safely cast to EHService.EHBinder.
viewHolder cannot be safely cast to SimpleViewHolder.

context cannot be safely cast to OnChosenListener.
other cannot be safely cast to ProfileLoadedLog.
other cannot be safely cast to ServiceLog.

smells.name: EqualsWithHashCodeExist
smells.description: Always override hashCode when you override equals. All hash-based collections depend on objects meeting the equals-contract. Two equal objects must produce the same hashcode. When inheriting equals or hashcode, override the inherited and call the super method for clarification.

instances.message: A class should always override hashCode when overriding equals and the other way around.

smells.name: LateinitUsage
smells.description: Usage of lateinit detected. Using lateinit for property initialization is error prone, try using constructor injection or delegation.

instances.message: Usages of latinit should be avoided.
Usages of latinit should be avoided.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: android.content.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
de.blox.graphview.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
android.os.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

instances.message: This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.
This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.

instances.message: The class Checkpoint defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class ProfileInfo defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.

smells.name: PreferToOverPairSyntax
smells.description: Pair was created using the Pair constructor, using the to syntax is preferred.

instances.message: Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `graph to nodeMap`

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message:
Parentheses in (context.toString() +
                    " must implement OnChosenListener") are unnecessary and can be replaced with: context.toString() +
                    " must implement OnChosenListener"

smells.name: ProtectedMemberInFinalClass
smells.description: Member with protected visibility in final class is private. Consider using private or internal as modifier.

instances.message: Member with protected visibility in final class is private. Consider using private or internal as modifier.

smells.name: ForbiddenComment
smells.description: Flags a forbidden comment. Defaults values are TODO:, FIXME: or STOPSHIP:

smells.name: UtilityClassWithPublicConstructor
smells.description: The class declaration is unnecessary because it only contains utility functions. An object declaration should be used instead.

instances.message: The class ServiceUtils only contains utility functions. Consider defining it as an object.

smells.description: Reports vals that can be const val instead.

smells.name: NestedClassesVisibility
smells.description: Nested types are often used for implementing private functionality and therefore this should not be public.

instances.message: Nested types are often used for implementing private functionality. However the visibility of CallReceiver makes it visible externally.
